style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Appleton Brewing
breweries.description: Appleton Brewing is under new management as of October 2004. On January 1, 2005, the new owners, Steve and Tom Lonsway, changed the brewpub's name to Stone Cellar Brewpub & Restaurant.

data.name: Adnams Tally Ho
data.description:
Brewed with Pale Ale, Crystal and Brown malts. Tally Ho is dark Mahogany red in colour with a rich, fruity aroma and a heart warming sweet raisin and biscuit palate.

Tally Ho is a limited edition Barley wine style beer, brewed at Adnams since 1880. Traditionally a Christmas beer, and brewed in October in limited quantities, many pubs lay a cask down like fine wine and save it for special occasions throughout the year.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Adnams Brewery
breweries.description: Adnams is one of England's oldest and most respected breweries, but despite its rich heritage and enduring fame, Adnams is not a company willing to rest on its laurels. Its continued commitment to quality and innovative packaging designs has made it Britain's fastest growing brewery over the last two years. To top it off, Adnams' head brewer was recently chosen as Britain's Brewer of the Year by a panel of his peers. The aggressive team at Adnams is raring to go and keen to make a mark in the U.S.

data.name: All Saints Barleywine
data.description: This Classic English Style Barley Wine is a strong ale, literally meaning wine from beer. It was once the strongest beer a brewer could make. This beer is big on malt, big on hops, and big on alcohol content. It can be enjoyed now and is also designed to age. Traditional Barley Wines are at their best between four months and six years. Ours is no exception.

breweries.name: All Saints Brewing Company
breweries.description:
All Saints Brewing Company is a new craft brewery in Greensburg, PA. Our mission is to build a brand focused on selling locally manufactured craft beer, for beer people, by beer people. Consistently good tasting craft beer, brewed locally and with Western Pennsylvania pride and passion.

Our brew house is a 7 bbl system which was originally installed at the Red Star Brewery in Greensburg, PA. The system was expanded when brought to All Saints Brewing Company. This expansion allows us additional capacity in addition to providing the opportunity to brew a number of diverse craft brews along with seasonal specialties and Jeff’s world famous barley wines.

data.name: ANNIVERSARY ALE
data.description: March Release. An English-style barleywine brewed to commemorate the birth of Drafting Table Brewing Company.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale

breweries.name: Drafting Table Brewing Company
breweries.description: Drafting Table Brewing Company (DTBC) is located in the Village Center Area of Wixom, Michigan.  Through a culmination of 4 years of professional brewing and 8 years of homebrewing experience DTBC seeks to provide artisan craft beer to lovers of ales and lagers around Metro-Detroit.  By uniting selective combinations of ingredients with meticulous brewing practices we keep a high standard for the beer we produce.  In addition to ales and lagers, we serve Detroit native Faygo soda and small snacks.  We encourage guests to bring in food from our surrounding restaurants or even from their own kitchen since we do not have a kitchen. We look forward to providing you with a product we are proud to make in an atmosphere that makes you want to come back.

data.name: Anniversary Ale 9
data.description:
For this year's birthday beer we've teamed up with renowned street artist, Mike Watt, to create a collaboration brew with a difference.

"Besides great beer, our other true pleasure in life is visual art," says Murray. "Every beer we brew has its own distinct personality and design. And now, we're introducing art to our anniversary, creating a limited edition bottle design in collaboration with guru, Mike Watt."

Mike Watt is an Australian artist and illustrator based in Sydney. His mediums vary from biro, spray paint, brush and ink to digital. He describes his style as "kind of gritty and ugly", normally showing characters with lots of personality that have lived an interesting life.
"It's always great collaborating with Murray's. They're really into their craft and they make amazing beer. I love working with anyone who is passionate about what they do - when it's making amazing beer it makes it even better!" said Mike Watt.

Murray's Anniversary Ale is always oak aged, always big and always a very limited release of around 1000 bottles. While this year's special brew gives a nod to its roots, reflecting the original recipe brewed to launch the company on New Year's Eve nine years ago, the recipe twist is aging the beer on Hunter Valley red wine barrel staves.

"These staves will not only add flavour and aroma from the inside surfaces that have been in contact with the red wine, but will also add raw oakiness from the outside surfaces of the staves," said Head Brewer, Graeme Mahy. "The end result of the staves provides a unique combination of part oaky, part red wine flavours."

An English-style barley wine, this year's Anniversary Ale features warming rich fruit cake-like sweetness from the caramel and roasted malts, with strong aromas of stone fruit and an assertive but balanced bitterness in the finish.

This big beer can be enjoyed now, however, we advise patience will be rewarded. Cellaring for 5-10 years (if you can) is recommended to maximise enjoyment from the maturing flavours.

"If you just can't hold out for 10 years, then try some over Christmas with a Christmas fruit pudding. Or in the New Year, with some ultra-rich and strong blue cheese," adds Graeme.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Murray's Craft Brewing Co
breweries.description:
At Murray’s we are fanatical about the quality of our beers. We use only the best quality ingredients sourced from Australia and around the world and we give all of our beers extended conditioning times – no rushing.

Established in late 2006 by passionate craft beer enthusiast, Murray Howe, Murray’s Craft Brewing Co. has quickly gained a reputation as one of Aust best Craft Brewers. So much so that we were awarded ‘Best Brewer in Australia’ in October 2012. 

Crafted in Port Stephens on the beach on the NSW Hunter region our hugely sought-after range of unconventional, unique and sometimes just plain weird – full-flavoured beers are available across Australia.

We’re not a corporation and we’d NEVER lower our standards to sell more beer. Rest-assured our beers have won more awards than our ads. Murray’s is proudly 100% Australian-owned.

Murray’s… Made of the Right Stuff.

breweries.name: Fegley's Brew Works
breweries.description:
At one of the most difficult times in the history of the City of Bethlehem, the Fegley family entered the brewing and restaurant business. The Bethlehem Steel plant had been shutting down slowly for years – a dying industrial giant of a bygone day – and the region was suffering the loss hard. The downtown had also been bled by the malls and box stores that promised savings to the consumer in exchange for genuine local culture and community. Yet on April 15th, 1998, the same day the the historic Hotel Bethlehem declared bankruptcy and closed, the Bethlehem Brew Works optimistically opened its doors to the public at the corner of Main and Broad Streets. The one other restaurant in the neighborhood closed the following week.

Bethlehem Brew Works chose to ignore the public exodus, and instead celebrated the history of ‘Steel’ and paid tribute to the region’s working class culture in it’s decor and menu. The Fegley’s believed a transformation was already well underway, and would grow with the city as it came to life. Over the course of a dozen years, the family became more involved in the community, and worked with the downtown shop owners to strengthen the downtown. One by one, new restaurants began open, and stores began to keep longer hours to accommodate the growing crowds. Historic Bethlehem now is home to a burgeoning restaurant row and retail shops of all kinds.
2002

Most importantly, the restaurant and brewery grew as well. The Steelgaarden lounge was added, and quickly became a Valley hotspot, and a few years later, the lounge exanded again, annexing another two shop spaces for more nightlife and event space. The kitchen also tripled in size with new space, and the brewery added additional tanks to keep up with the demand for the brews.
2005

With an eye still on things to come, the family looked west into Allentown. Opportunity was difficult to see in a city who’s retail heyday had ended some years before with the departure of Hess’s department store. But the optimistic Fegleys became smitten with the history of the “Queen city” – from it’s role in the War of Independence, to the great silk industry that supplied the world’s fashions, and the great retail era the followed. “The All-American City” as it was known, seemed to be frosted over – and the Fegleys believed it was about to thaw.
2007

In June 2007, years in the making, the Allentown Brew Works opened on Hamilton Street, housed inside the historic Harold’s Furniture Building. Proud to be part of another resurging downtown, the 400 seat restaurant is a testament to the vibrant heartbeat that thrives in the city. Offering two and a half levels of dining, plus state-of-the-art banquet facilities in The Hamilton Room, and multiple bars offering different atmospheres, as well as an outdoor casual patio, Der Biergarten and a new seductive lower level lounge, Silk. The 15-barrel brewery in the Allentown location boasts seven fermentation tanks and eight serving tanks – built with capacity to add a bottling line and begin outside sales of Fegley’s Brew Works in earnest.
2008

In 2008, the Philadelphia Phillies AAA team, the Iron Pigs, opened the new Coca-Cola Park stadium, and added Fegley’s Brew Works to its lineup. With that account in place, and a new sales team behind the brewery sales, Fegley’s Brew Works can now be found at almost 200 locations in the region from Harrisburg to central New Jersey, north to Scranton, and south to Philadelphia where it is very popular.
2010

One of the nation’s leading beer writers and co-founder of Philly Beer Week, Don Russell (aka Joe Sixpack), named Hop’Solutely the Beer of the Year.

Becoming supportive and active in the Allentown community, during their first few years the Brew Works saw eateries come and go. In 2010, the tide seemed to change with major restaurants adding to the draw of the city. For some time, the Fegleys had been constantly thinking up good ideas that they would love to see happen in the neighborhood, when it finally struck them that they should just do it themselves. In an effort to continue to move the Fegley brand toward healthy, sustainable “green” practices, they chose concepts that would fit that ideal.
2011 to Present

In 2011, Fegley’s brewery continues to be recognized as their Arctic Alchemy wins it’s first bronze medal at the Great American Beer Festival and Blueberry Belch wins “Best Summer Beer” at the Philadelphia Summer Ale Festival at the Philadelphia Zoo . Arctic Alchemy goes on to win a gold medal at GABF in 2014 and the pubs continue to win Reader’s Choice Awards and Best of the Valley Awards. View our complete awards list.

With the addition of a bottling line, and the growing success of outside accounts the brewery is closing in on it’s capacity, and soon Fegley’s will begin to nose their way to new opportunities. Perhaps there’s another fragrant wallflower ready to dance.

data.name: Barbieswine
data.description: Our barley wine is what would be considered an English-style barley wine.  We aged this high gravity beer for 9 months before its release; 60% in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels and 40% in stainless steel, blended back together to achieve a balance of complex notes from the liquor barrels, but still preserving the malt flavors that can be lost in the barrel aging process.  We are releasing this offering in kegs, and we will also be doing a limited release of 22 oz bottles, perfect for cellaring.

breweries.name: Pig Pounder Brewery
breweries.description: The Pig Pounder Brewery is named after a beer launched by the Darryl's restaurant chain in 1988. It is a local microbrewery specializing in producing outstanding authentic UK style beers including types like an Extra Special Bitter, an English Dark Mild, and a classic Milk Stout, for local venues. The brewery also features an interactive tasting room, made for connecting with our guests and educating them more about beer.

data.name: Barley Wine
data.foodPairings: Mild and creamy cheeses; rich dishes like osso bucco and roast pork.

breweries.name: Midtfyns Bryghus
breweries.description: Micro brewery Midtfyns Brewery was founded in the fall of 2004, and the first beer was launched in March 2005. In the beginning  the beer was brewed under license from Scotland. When Eddie Szweda took over the management of the brewery in November 2006, he undertook radical changes for the small brewery in Brobyværk. Production was changed and a line of new and exciting beers developed by the brewery itself.

breweries.name: Partizan Brewing
breweries.description: We intend to start by doing what’s necessary; then do what’s possible; and eventually we hope to be doing the impossible.

breweries.name: Arizona Wilderness Brewing Company
breweries.description:
For years we've dreamed of bringing together our two loves: The beautiful and diverse state of Arizona together with hand crafted, artisanal ales. While backpacking the wondrous depths of Arizona we forged ideas that would one day become Arizona Wilderness Brewing Co. Well, here we are! We will continue our endeavor into the remote beauties of both the Arizona Wilderness and Craft Beer.

Our belief is that beer is more than a beverage to guzzle on Sundays, just another beverage at the party, or cheap yellow fizzy stuff dad drank while wearing his dirty flannel shirts. Beer is culture and we have a true PASSION for this amazing beverage! Check out our food menu, as it was created to pair quite nicely with our fine ales. C’mon in and see what we are up to next!

data.name: Barley Wine · Nutcracker
data.description:
Barley Wines are fermented strong beers. The name indicates the wine comparable high alcohol content. By 1900, the term "barley wine" was first used in England as beer style.
We have named our Barley Wine Nutcracker. Its robustness and nutty - caramel aromas suggest this name. The yeast brings during fermentation fruity components with one, which remember the intense malt aroma of dried fruit and honey.
A very complex beer, that can not be say the 10 vol% alcohol.

· Steamed artichokes
· Duck confit
· Panforte
· Stilton with walnuts

breweries.name: Brew Age
breweries.description:
How it all began and where the journey should go

It all started as a hobby in 2006 were brewing Tom and John in preserving pot their first beer. Apparently hats tasted, because it soon emerged that there should be more than just a hobby. Toms brother Michael came into the game and the initial thinking to open a microbrewery were the end of 2007 in the room. The onetime still very amateurish plans were (from the current perspective thankfully) not implemented. The idea persisted, however. And so Tom and John went once to Weihenstephan to study at TUM brewing and beverage technology. In early 2012, the plans were revived and Raphael came on board.

We played different scenarios: Own Brewery vs. Gypsy Brewing, building the brand, and most importantly the recipe development. It quickly became apparent that the construction of their own brewing equipment from the beginning is difficult to achieve and for us the concept as Gypsy Brewer is the path to the goal. After an intensive search for a partner brewery we could start our cooperation with Reinhold Barta Brauhaus cast. Even today, we brew our beers in the casting, and so you could call us sedentary migrant Brauer, because unlike classic Gypsy brewers that produce many breweries (blank), we brew our beers to our ideas almost exclusively in the casting.

Looking ahead, we are aiming for the establishment of our own brewery in Vienna.

breweries.name: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery
breweries.description: We are a small packaging microbrewery located in Farmville, North Carolina. We sold our first beer in August of 2004. We specialize in beautiful, delicious, full flavored dark beers. When we brew, we’re happy and we dance. During fermentation, we sing softly to the yeast. Please try our beer and enjoy a taste of contentment!

data.name: Barleywine
data.description: Barleywines are brewed and reserved for special occasions. Big malt and fruit flavors along with significant amounts of hops balance this big alcohol beer. For this style of beer aging is essential, therefore we aged ours for over a year.

breweries.name: Dust Bowl Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Welcome to Dust Bowl Brewing Company located in Turlock, Ca. We are a small brewing company in the Central Valley of California. Our size allows us to have a very personal and passionate connection to each of our beers. We are continuously testing new flavors and styles to develop our selection of beers. Our goal is to help create a thriving beer culture in the Central Valley.

Our company is a tribute to the strong-willed, gritty people of the Dust Bowl and Great Depression era. Inspired by the families who came west in search of a new start as well as those who stayed behind to weather the storm. This is great beer born of hard times. Storm’s comin’!

data.name: Barnaby, Barley Wine
data.description: Barnaby is an exquisitely simple, yet remarkably complex single malt, single hop English Barley Wine. Rich malty aromas reminiscent of caramel, brown sugar, ripe stone fruit and floral hops finishes silky smooth and incredibly satisfying.

breweries.name: Fort Collins Brewery
breweries.description:
Fort Collins Brewery & Tavern is a family-owned, handcrafted microbrewery and full service tavern in Northern Colorado, established in 2003. FCB offers an outstanding line up of 50 ales and lagers that can be found on tap as well as in bottles throughout the U.S. For more information, visit fortcollinsbrewery.com or call 970-472-1499. 
Create – Share – Savor

breweries.name: Sun King Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sun King Brewing Company is an Indianapolis-based craft brewery with a focus on continually creating traditional seasonal and unique specialty beers. 

Sun King rolled its first keg of beer out the door in July 2009 and since that time has grown into the second largest brewery in Indiana, producing over 27,000 barrels of beer in 2014 while selling all of it in Indiana. Sun King's beers have been awarded multiple medals at the Great American Beer Festival and World Beer Cup.

Located in a downtown Indianapolis warehouse, Sun King was the first full-scale production brewery in Indianapolis since 1948. Sun King beer can be enjoyed at fine bars/restaurants and liquor stores throughout Indiana or in their Tasting Room, located in the brewery at 135 N. College Avenue.

breweries.name: Rockford Brewing Company
breweries.description: RBC produces world class beers using traditional and innovative brewing techniques and ingredients. As a company, we strive to create unique beers with influences from countries around the world including the United States, Belgium, Germany, the United Kingdom, and the newest emerging craft beer location that has the world watching; Michigan. Part of our niche is working closely with West Michigan farmers and local ingredients on a seasonal basis. We love to incorporate West Michigan agricultural products into our offerings!

data.name: Bigfoot
data.description: Our award-winning barleywine boasts a dense, fruity bouquet, an intense flavor palate and a deep reddish-brown color. Its big maltiness is superbly balanced by a wonderfully bittersweet hoppiness.

Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

data.name: Billionaire
data.description: There are 1011 billionaires on planet Earth as of this writing. We guess that most of you, like all of us here at Clown Shoes, aren't even close to being on that list and yet dream, every now and then, billionaire dreams. Our fourth anniversary beer was crafted to make you feel wealthy: a sweet, rich and heavily malted Barley Wine Ale brewed with English yeast then aged in European Cognac barrels.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Clown Shoes Beer
breweries.description:
Founded in December 2009 by beer lovers trying to make work fun again, Clown Shoes has been redefining what craft beer should be. We strive to add our own little creative twists on under-represented styles and styles in need of change.

Our mission now is to produce beer without pretension while being free and a little crazy.

data.name: Bishopsgate
data.description: Barleywines were originally brewed to replace French wines in the cellars of the most discerning British drinkers. An abundance of malted barley gives Bishopsgate a rich complexity, starting with a floral nose and ending with a full-bodied toffee finish. These intense flavors are aged for sixty days and, if cellared, will continue to mingle and harmonize for years.

breweries.name: Strange Land Brewery
breweries.description: Our story is not unlike many a beer journeyman before us—we’re intoxicated with the mystery of fermentation, the possibilities of taste, and chasing after unexplored horizons. Our goal is simply to make beer —

breweries.name: Brouwerij de Molen
breweries.description: Our brewery is world-famous for our large variety of (imperial) stouts, ales and smoked ales. We want to make good quality beer with respect for people and the environment.

data.name: Bourbon Barleywine
data.description: A sipping beer to the core, Barleywine by itself is a traditional British digestif. After months of maturation in Bourbon barrels, our barleywine mellows thoroughly, with a luxuriously rich mouthfeel and a soft, rounded finish. Caramel malts shine through on this copper hued ale with hints of vanillin imparted by the toasted oak barrels, making Bourbon Barleywine a decadent accompaniment to sweets, or a dessert all by itself.
data.foodPairings: Flaky, crusty desserts, rich blue vein cheeses and hearty stews.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale

breweries.name: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery is proud to be a member of the thriving craft beer scene in Richmond, VA.  Located in Richmond’s historic German brewing district, Hardywood features a 20 barrel brewing system, public taproom and outdoor beer garden, and a private event taproom.  Join us during public taproom hours, Wednesday through Sunday, and enjoy free live music, bocce ball, corn hole, local food trucks, craft fairs and brewery tours in addition to our award winning craft beer, brewed in the heart of Richmond.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
WED-FRI: 4-9PM
SAT: 2-9PM
SUN: 12-6PM 
visit www.hardywood.com/tasting-room for details.

data.name: Bourbon County Brand Barleywine
data.description: Aged in the third-use barrels that were once home to Kentucky bourbon and then our renowned Bourbon County Stout, this traditional English-style barleywine possesses the subtlety of flavor that only comes from a barrel that’s gone through many seasons of ritual care. The intricacies of the previous barrel denizens – oak, charcoal, hints of tobacco and vanilla, and that signature bourbon heat – are all present in this beer. Hearty and complex, Bourbon County Brand Barleywine is a titan and a timeline; a bold, flavorful journey through the craft of barrel aging.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. breweries.name: Goose Island Beer Company
breweries.description:
When the first Goose Island Brewpub opened its doors in 1988, domestic, mass-produced beer was deeply ingrained in Midwestern culture. The craft beer industry was still in its infancy, with only a handful of brewpubs in existence in the Midwest. In his travels across Europe, beer-lover John Hall had enjoyed a distinctive local brew in each region he visited. Hall was convinced that Midwesterners could produce beers as good or better than those he’d tasted in his travels. Living on the shore of the largest system of fresh water on the planet Earth, in a city with rapidly evolving tastes – John decided that his hometown, Chicago, would be the ideal place to do just that.

The key to building interest in craft beer, Hall decided, was to allow consumers to watch the brewing process – while providing them with the then-novel experience of enjoying a wide variety of distinctive beers that had been produced on-site. Hall wanted to not only cater to his customers’ tastes, but to challenge them as well. Goose Island’s brewers set to work crafting a diverse selection of unique beers – and on Friday, May 13, 1988 the Goose Island Brewpub was born.

It turned out that John was right; Chicagoans palates evolved rapidly once Goose Island’s Brewpub opened its doors and introduced the city to distinctive craft beer. By 1995, the brewpub had become so popular that John Hall decided to open a larger brewery and bottling plant to keep up with demand. Finding still more room for growth, in 1999 Hall opened a second Goose Island Brewpub just a stone’s throw away from historic Wrigley Field.

Today, Goose Island continues to brew an innovative selection of over 50 craft beers at the brewpub, the best of which are then bottled at our Fulton Street brewery. Goose Island beers are now enjoyed in all 50 states and Europe.

data.name: Breakneck Barleywine
data.description: Rob Denton’s latest signature series is a whopping 10% abv classic English Barleywine. Breakneck is warming and syrupy sweet with a balanced hop profile. A product of our R+D “mini-me” tank there are only 10 total barrels of this limited edition beer. Breakneck is a challenging out of bounds ski run at Jackson Hole. Be careful or you may find yourself rag-dolling down the face!

breweries.name: Snake River Brewing
breweries.description:
America's most award-winning small brewery since 1994 offering a wide array of lagers and ales with hand-crafted cuisine. Locals and tourists alike co-mingle in a friendly and casual environment.

Make yourself at home at Snake River Brewing in the heart of the Teton Mountain Range. All roads, trails, bike paths, climbing routes and ski runs lead to “The Brewpub”! After a day in the great outdoors how can you not partake of a tasty malt beverage and a delicious meal

data.name: Bullion
data.description:
A light colored, exceptionally well balanced smooth ale with a light fragrant hop finish.

Bronze award winner at the CAMRA Great British Beer Festival 2000.

data.name: Bum Rush
data.description: The style is Barleywine and it is a storng ale, it is not a wine. Commercial example would be BigFoot Barleywine from Sierra Nevada. Bum Rush has a strong, intense malt flavor with noticeable bitterness. Brewed with 5 different hops. Copper color with hop aroma from dry-hopping. "Bum Rush" is a term from the 1920's meaning that a patron was forcibly ejected from a tavern, i.e. they got the bum rush!

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Barley Island Brewing Company
breweries.description: Barley Island’s national award winning handcrafted ales produced on-premise with only the finest malts and hops. Being independently owned and operated has its advantages. We can quickly implement new food trends or even beer flavors to suit our local clientele.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Monday - Thursday: 11 am - 12 am
Sunday: 12 pm - 12 am
Friday - Saturday: 11 am - 1 am

data.name: Cereal Killer
data.description:
Brewed in the traditional English style of Barleywines, Cereal Killer is an explosion of full-bodied, malty goodness. Huge syrupy flavors flow over caramel, toffee, molasses and toasty notes. All these rich malt flavors are balanced out nicely by just the right amount of citrus-like hoppy bitterness. A high alcohol content makes this a beer for the cellar. As this brew ages, it will continue to develop more sherry-like flavors and aromas similar to a cask-aged port.

This is a BIG beer. True to our original vision, we have taken a traditional style and tweaked it a bit. Delicious on its own, Cereal Killer is also brilliant with many foods, or as a digestif.
Recommended Foods: Limburger or Stilton Cheese, Wild Game, Baked Ham with Brown Sugar

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Arcadia Ales
breweries.description:
Arcadia Ales was established in 1996 as a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted British-style ales. All of our beers are produced in small batches, and our 25 Barrel Peter Austin Brewery and methods originated in England, which allows this style of beer to reflect over 250 years of world class brewing heritage.

In addition to brewing on authentic British equipment, Arcadia uses only the finest malted barley from England, and when combined with the freshest hops from the Pacific Northwest of our United States, and our legendary Ringwood yeast, the result is some of the best and freshest handcrafted ales available, on any continent.

data.name: Civilization
data.description: Built on the backbone of a classic English Barleywine with the addition of dried Prussian lemons, tart cherries, and cranberries. Dark fruit abounds with roasted goodness in each sip. Hints of melon and tropical notes on the nose. Long lingering finish that is rich yet not cloying that is reminiscent of fresh baked bread, bright citrus, and mellow pit fruit. Bold and complex at 12% with new layers emerging as your goblet warms.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. breweries.name: Wild Heaven Craft Beers
breweries.description: Wild Heaven is a Georgia company created by lifelong Georgians - founder Nick Purdy (also Publisher of Paste Magazine) with beer recipes designed by Trappeze Pub owner Eric Johnson. Our core year-round portfolio is focused on world-class beers designed to offer something new to the beer landscape—not simply creating our version of what everyone else is doing.

data.name: Dark New Day
data.description: Our dark barley wine was brewed with traditional English Marris Otter base malt along with three different types of crystal malt, giving it a smooth mouth-feel that is full of caramel and toffee notes. Just enough roasted malt was added to give this beer a twist from tradition and deep brown color with mild hints of chocolate in the aroma. Balanced with English Goldings hops, this easy-drinking barley wine was named in honor of our Brewer Joe Wilkinson's newborn son Easton.

breweries.name: Perrin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located 10 minutes north of downtown Grand Rapids, Michigan, our micro brewery and taproom is striving to bring a world class experience to every person who walks through our doors.

With a hospitality philosophy of treating our customers like they're guests in our home, we look forward to serving you.

data.name: Dibs Are for Dummies
data.description:
The wind howls. Snow piles up, melts, then freezes.
Days pass without direct sunlight. It's wintertime in Chicago.
You can forget about parking--all of the spots are taken,
saved by miscellaneous crap, known as "dibs."
The tradition is practiced by first-rate idiots.
So you park a mile away, shivering on your walk home.
But this will be waiting for you, ready to warm your bitter heart.
Our English-style Barleywine is chewy and rich, accented by an addition of honey.
Kick over that chair, dibs are for dummies.

breweries.name: Spiteful Brewing
breweries.description: We are a Chicago nanobrewery committed to brewing proper beer and delivering it to Chicagoans one case at a time.  We brew on a 3.5 bbl brew house and offer 12oz cans in 6 Packs, 16oz cans in 4 Packs, and 22oz bombers.  A few kegs pop up in town as well.

data.name: Elizabethan Ale
data.description: Elizabethan Ale was originally produced in celebration of the Coronation of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. This strong barley wine is reminiscent of the "October Ales" which were brewed in domestic brewhouses during the sixteenth century.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

data.name: English Barley Wine
data.description: One malt + two hops = one easy drinking Winter Ale.  No spices in this ale!  Translucent caramel in color, well rounded sweet biscuity aromas, a fine balance of malt and resinous hops that creates a simple, straight forward winter warmer.  Brewed with Gambrinus ESB malt, Perle and U.K. Goldings hops with our proprietary English yeast strain.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. breweries.name: Redwood Curtain Brewing
breweries.description:
We desire to share our passion and interest in craft beer with everyone from the first time sipper to the seasoned enthusiast. Providing academic and hands on experiences are a big part of this desire to help people expand and trust their own senses.

All of our handcrafted artisan ales are served and properly aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. Our expressive beers can be very complex and assertive, but the with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We only use premium domestic and imported malts and hops, Humboldt County water and our multiply yeast strains. You will not find any artificial additives or preservatives in our beers.

We trust that our craft beer and brewing techniques convey our philosophies concerning family, friends, community, education and living life to its fullest. Cheers!

style.name: British-Style Barley Wine Ale
style.description: British-style barley wines range from tawny copper to dark brown in color and have a full body and high residual malty sweetness. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Helltown Brewing
breweries.description:
Helltown Brewing is a craft brewery located in Mount Pleasant, Pennsylvania- a small town situated in the the foothills of the Laurel Highlands.
The brewery, named in homage to our home town, will be brewing a variety of exceptional beer from IPAs to the traditional lambic styles

data.name: Hagrid
data.description: A big, malty, magical beer that is amber in color and deceptively strong. The rather large alcohol content is masked by the creative grain bill and deliberately assertive English hop profile. The result is sweet and smooth with hints of nuts and delicate spice. A few of these and you are bound to be you waving your own magic wand around (to mixed results, of course).

breweries.name: One Barrel Brewing
breweries.description: Madison's smallest brewery opened on Friday, July 6 2012. One Barrel Brewing Company is at the intersection of Atwood and Winnebago streets, a.k.a. Schenk's Corners, it's like a coffee shop, only with beer instead of coffee". With a staple of No. 2 Strong Ale, other usual suspects include Penguin Pale Ale (a Belgian pale ale), and The Commuter (a Kölsch-style ale), but the small brew system will allows up to 10 beers on tap at a time, constant rotation of new brews.

Complexity of alcohols and fruity-ester characters are often high and counterbalanced by the perception of low to medium bitterness and extraordinary alcohol content. Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

Hop aroma and flavor may be minimal to medium. English type hops are often used but not necessary for this style. Low levels of diacetyl may be acceptable. Caramel and some characters indicating oxidation, such as vinous (sometimes sherry-like) aromas and/or flavors, may be considered positive. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
